definition: a step/a pace/walk/march/stages in a process/situation
to harmonize/to reconcile/to blend/to suit well/to adjust/to regulate/to season (food)/to provoke/to incite
to transfer/to move (troops or cadres)/to investigate/to enquire into/accent/view/argument/key (in music)/mode (music)/tune/tone/melody

sentences.english: Write a book, cross the ocean, take a new job, change your pace. ------ William James.
sentences.chinese: 写一本书，越过大洋，接受新工作，变换你的步调。

sentences.english: And vice-a-versa, all at the perfect pace.
sentences.chinese: 反之亦然，一切都以完美的步调进行。

sentences.english: A fast-paced side-scrolling shooting game with very nice graphics.
sentences.chinese: 一场步调快速的边卷动射击比赛与非常好的图表。

sentences.english: In an urban society in which highly structured.
sentences.chinese: 在城市社会里，结构严密，步调迅速。

sentences.english: Observe your interviewer, and match that style and pace.
sentences.chinese: 观察面试官，并与其风格和步调协调一致。

sentences.english: The overall BOM Publishing process has four main steps , which are illustrated below .
sentences.chinese: 公布明细表的过程统共有四个步调，如下图所示。

sentences.english: But this prolific pace might be part of a problem.
sentences.chinese: 但是这种多产的发展步调可能会带来麻烦。

sentences.english: If the touch early warning line, export pace easily remind sellers adjust replenishment.
sentences.chinese: 倘若触碰预警线，出口易会提醒卖家调整补货步调。

sentences.english: Start with a soft, slow roll, gradually picking up the pace and pressure.
sentences.chinese: 开始要轻柔，慢慢轮转，逐步提高步调和压力。

sentences.english: It's like a military march- every one in step.
sentences.chinese: 它就像部队行军，每个人都步调一致。

sentences.english: This helps in achieving a sustainable pace of work.
sentences.chinese: 这有助于实现可持续的工作步调。

sentences.english: He turned, and with a firm and quick step he walked across the empty space.
sentences.chinese: 小伙子转过身，迈着动摇的步调快捷走过空阔的园地。

sentences.english: He after of ride soon similar to my path and pace, I also didn't care(seem that mood be aller right! ).
sentences.chinese: 他之后的骑速就和我的步调一样了，我也没在意。

sentences.english: His work has walked in lockstep with his Catholic faith.
sentences.chinese: 他的工作与他的天主教信仰步调一致。

sentences.english: To welcome the steamer, a long line of honor guards marched all in step.
sentences.chinese: 为了欢迎轮船的到来，一支仪仗队步调合拍的行进着。

sentences.english: Yet the six have nonetheless managed to keep in step.
sentences.chinese: 然而最近这六国却试图言行统一，步调一致。

definition: to follow the prescribed order; to keep to the working routine (idiom)
to go forward/to forge ahead/to advance/onward
to blindly follow suit (idiom)/to imitate slavishly/to do what everyone else is doing
to mark time (military)/to make no headway
to slow/to slow down (the pace of)
to run in the opposite direction (idiom); to run counter to
